Ragnar stood corrected.

Ragnar: Good point, and one I tend to forget. Clan technology tends to 
use fusion engines on almost everything, so our internal energy 
sources for mechs are almost limitless.

He steps into a narrow clearing that leads to a metallic protuberance.

Ragnar: There is the base. I assume Rodimus is done with his personnal 
matter, with all the time we left him. Let us go.

He advances but slows down a bit.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Windlord::
> 
> "But as machines, we need energy"replied Windlord
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Ragnar stomped his way up a small hill. Doing so, he crushed a 
dead 
> > tree under his birdlike foot.
> > 
> > Ragnar: The base is now four klicks farther. We should be there 
> soon. 
> > But how can you be hungry? You are machines, quiaff? I am still 
> very 
> > human and do not need to feed.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Windlord::
> > > 
> > > "Hey!" said windlord to Ragnar"Is your base so far????? How many 
> > time 
> > > will we walking towards your base? I don'ty know what my friend 
> > > things but I'm a bit hungry.."
